passes.help: Page must have means to bypass repeated blocks

relatedNodes.html: Testing for Sleep-Disordered Breathing in Psychiatric Practice
Dr Barry Krakow comments on Benca and colleagues recent review of sleep apnea in psychiatric practice and calls for clinicians to screen for sleep-disordered breathing at intake.
Clinical Outcomes of IV Ketamine for Depression

Short-term clinical trials found intravenous (IV) ketamine to be effective in reducing depressive symptoms. This study assessed longer-term outcomes of IV ketamine for depression and explored treatment and patient factors that may affect results.
Oral Anticoagulants, Atrial Fibrillation, and Mental Illness

People with atrial fibrillation (AF) and comorbid mental illness are less often prescribed an oral anticoagulant (OAC) for AF-related stroke prevention. This study examined how mental illness interacts with OAC treatment patterns in people with AF.
Guideline Concordance in Major Depressive Disorder
This study created a new score to measure treatment guideline adherence and found that following guidelines resulted in lower MDD symptom severity.
Outcome Predictors in Youth With Mental Disorders

This retrospective analysis of clinical parameters in youth hospitalized for psychiatric treatment assessed magnitude and correlates of symptom response, global illness response, social functioning, out-of-home placement, and length of stay.
Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Zuranolone in MDD
Most patients with MDD achieved response after 14 days of zuranolone treatment. For patients who responded to their first treatment, the time to repeat treatment was over 4 months.
Metformin for SGA-Induced Weight Gain

Pediatric patients are vulnerable to antipsychotic-induced weight gain (AIWG). This study assessed the effectiveness of metformin on AIWG and explored whether timing of metformin initiation and premorbid obesity moderated metformin effectiveness in youth.
A Comparison of 3 Scales for Measuring Adolescent Depression
A 65-Year-Old Man With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis and Psychiatric Distress

This case shows the psychological and pharmacologic aspects of providing tailored care for a patient with ALS. The authors discuss how these approaches impacted the patient and how ALS-specific challenges presented throughout treatment.
The Psychological Burden of ALS, the Enduring Strength of People Living With ALS, and the Tools We Can Use to Help

Commenting on a recent article by Lester et al, the authors discuss the psychological impacts of diagnosis, genetic testing, and disease progression on patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: Dr Barry Krakow comments on Benca and colleagues recent review of sleep apnea in psychiatric practice and calls for clinicians to screen for sleep-disordered breathing at intake.

nodes.html: Clinical Outcomes of IV Ketamine for Depression

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: Short-term clinical trials found intravenous (IV) ketamine to be effective in reducing depressive symptoms. This study assessed longer-term outcomes of IV ketamine for depression and explored treatment and patient factors that may affect results.

any.message: Heading order valid
Heading order valid

nodes.html: Oral Anticoagulants, Atrial Fibrillation, and Mental Illness

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: People with atrial fibrillation (AF) and comorbid mental illness are less often prescribed an oral anticoagulant (OAC) for AF-related stroke prevention. This study examined how mental illness interacts with OAC treatment patterns in people with AF.

nodes.html: Guideline Concordance in Major Depressive Disorder

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: This study created a new score to measure treatment guideline adherence and found that following guidelines resulted in lower MDD symptom severity.

nodes.html: Outcome Predictors in Youth With Mental Disorders

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: This retrospective analysis of clinical parameters in youth hospitalized for psychiatric treatment assessed magnitude and correlates of symptom response, global illness response, social functioning, out-of-home placement, and length of stay.

nodes.html: Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Zuranolone in MDD

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: Most patients with MDD achieved response after 14 days of zuranolone treatment. For patients who responded to their first treatment, the time to repeat treatment was over 4 months.

nodes.html: Metformin for SGA-Induced Weight Gain

any.message: Heading order valid

nodes.html: Pediatric patients are vulnerable to antipsychotic-induced weight gain (AIWG). This study assessed the effectiveness of metformin on AIWG and explored whether timing of metformin initiation and premorbid obesity moderated metformin effectiveness in youth.
